Dear Sheffield City Council,
I'd like to request the following information is revealed:
- The total number of schools in the local authority.
- Of these, the number of schools using some form of 'temporary or emergency accommodation' for some of their functions, as of 5th September 2023.
- Examples of temporary accommodation being used (marquee, portacabin, disused office space etc.)
Yours faithfully,
Fraser Knight

Dear Fraser Knight,
Thank you for your request for information relating to temporary or
emergency accommodation in schools which we received on 04/09/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
The total number of schools in the local authority.
• The Local Authority holds responsibility for 73 Maintained Schools
Of these, the number of schools using some form of 'temporary or emergency
accommodation' for some of their functions, as of 5th September 2023.
Examples of temporary accommodation being used (marquee, portacabin,
disused office space etc.)
• Of those schools, and as at 5^th September, only one school – Abbey
Lane Primary – has any form of temporary or emergency accommodation,
namely a mobile kitchen unit to continue the provision of school meals
on-site whilst work is undertaken to remove RAAC from the roof above
the school kitchen.
This temporary kitchen will be removed when the RAAC replacement project
is completed, expected 1^st December 2023.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ
